pullRequest.body:
from `Algebra.BigOperators.Order` . Add the corresponding `WithBot` lemmas.

Looks good to me, although I think in the future we'll want to rename the `Mathlib.Order.WithBot` module to `Mathlib.Order.WithTop`, since the latter is currently more common.

Not an issue per se, but it's not obvious simply by looking at the code that the lhs is coerced to `WithTop Î±`, since usually the lhs' type is fixed and the rhs may or may not be explicitely coerced.

```suggestion
@[simp, norm_cast] lemma coe_sum (s : Finset Î¹) (f : Î¹ â†’ Î±) :
    (âˆ‘ i in s, f i : WithTop Î±) = âˆ‘ i in s, (f i : WithTop Î±) := map_sum addHom f s
```
This pattern is already used elsewhere
Fair, I'm just used to automatic coercion giving up when the lhs doesn't have an output type fixed

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: Split off `WithTop` lemmas
